conversation.content:
[confused] So, um, I never meant for this to happen. Like, I just posted that one video about the parking meters thing, you know? And suddenly—[pause]—suddenly I'm getting these messages calling me, er, "the voice of the resistance" or whatever. [nervous laugh] Which is honestly insane because, I mean, do I think the new meters are overpriced? Yeah, sure. But am I ready to, like, lead some kind of revolution about it? [frustrated] God, no.

The thing is, everybody keeps tagging me in stuff now. "Jane said this" and "Jane believes that" and I'm just—[sigh]—I'm literally just Jane from accounting who, uh, happened to film herself complaining one time. [anxiously] And now there's apparently a protest next week? With my face on the flyers? [short pause] I didn't approve that.

[quietly] Here's what really gets me though. Part of me actually does care about this stuff. Sort of. Like, hmm, maybe thirty percent of me thinks we should fight back, but the other seventy percent just wants to, you know, go back to being invisible. [trailing off] Is that terrible? That I'm accidentally inspiring people with something I barely...

[hesitantly] Actually, wait. Maybe that's exactly who should be doing this. Someone who isn't, er, completely sure. [slowly] Someone normal. [long pause] Or maybe I'm just trying to justify this whole mess.
